meanings.definition: A person who imitates or uses archaic language or style.
meanings.sent1: The archaizers at the Renaissance fair spoke in old-fashioned words.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that an archaizer is someone who likes to talk like people did long ago.
meanings.sent3: The group of archaizers decided to have a competition to see who could speak the most like Shakespeare.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the archaizer of the family, always using phrases from ancient texts.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the character was portrayed as an archaizer, constantly quoting from classic literature.

meanings.definition: To imitate or use archaic language or style.
meanings.sent1: The author archaizers in his writing to create a historical atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: People sometimes archaize when they want to sound more formal.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to archaize during his stand-up routine, pretending to be a medieval jester.
meanings.sent4: She archaized her speech to match the theme of the historical event.
meanings.sent5: The students were asked to archaize their language for the Shakespearean play they were performing.
